review: Faster than our game systems for accessing netflix and whatnot. Great size to bring on work travel and use on hotel TVs. It may be less useful if you have a smart TV with all sorts of apps built in, but it works great on ours. One issue that i'm fairly certain is our tv's issue: even if the stick is set to "sleep" the TV still thinks it's getting data and doesn't go to sleep the way it normally would if you had the input set to a cablebox or game console that was off.

author: Don Glaser

review: Several months in and still no VUDU support (Flixster sucks, it freezes up, doesn't load your titles, and stutters when playing content). Many of the apps freeze and crash. Load times are ridiculously long on some apps, but quick if you're accessing Amazon content. As far as accessing your Amazon and Amazon Prime content, there's nothing better, unfortunately I expected it to be more on par with Roku and it's not. Hopefully the next couple of months will bring some updates to the stick to make it more stable and bring the features advertised when I purchased it. There's promise with this gadget, but (as my grade school teachers used to say frequently) it isn't meeting its potential.
author: Scott T. Smith

review: Had trouble initially to download apps due to an extreme delay in an upgrade of fire stick that was not told in setup would need to be done. Had to call customer service for help.  After which, apps downloaded ok, but Netflix buffers a lot, and even get messages, unable to stream your movie at this time, please try again later. Very frustrating to watch movies when interrupted numerous times with buffering. I don't have that problem with Amazon videos. I have a fast broadband network with dual band Wi-Fi and never have that problem with my computer, laptop, or smart phone which are in same room as TV with fire stick. For the money, I probably shouldn't complain, but frustrating none the less.
